sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"贸易，交易"之意。
means: business ： 指包括售货、购货、换货在内的综合商业活动，方式可以是批发或零售。
commerce ： 多指大规模的买卖或易货关系。
trade ： 普通用词，含义广。既可指某种具体的商业又可指广泛的贸易。
bargain ： 多指买卖双方通过谈判、协商就商品质量、数量、价格等项达成协议所成的生意。
deal ： 口语用词，指买卖双方经过交涉达成协议成交。

sentence.Network_en: I have tried to pack a good deal into a few words.
The president beat his breast and called that deal a mistake.
sentence.Network_cn: 总裁捶胸顿足，称那是个错误的交易。

sentence.Network_en: The deal seems so attractive it would be ridiculous to say no.
sentence.Network_cn: 这笔交易看上去太诱人了，要是拒绝它简直是笑话。

lj.lj_ly: they don't make a big deal out of minor irritations.

jx.jx_en_mean: informal a situation in which someone receives unfair or harsh treatment

lj.lj_ly: he lost a deal of blood.
I don't know a great deal about politics.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to express one's assent to an agreement
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)就这么办，就这么定了

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dælan 'divide', 'participate', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch deel and German Teil 'part' (noun), also to dole. The sense 'divide' gave rise to 'distribute', hence senses 1 and 4 of the verb; the sense 'participate' gave rise to 'have dealings with', hence senses 2 and 3 of the verb
Middle English: from Middle Low German and Middle Dutch dele 'plank'

entry.def: If you say that you need or have a great deal of or a good deal of a particular thing, you are emphasizing that you need or have a lot of it.

example.ex: I am in a position to save you a good deal of time.
example.tran: 我能够为你节省许多时间。

entry.def: A deal of something is a lot of it.

example.ex: He had a deal of work to do.

entry.def: If you make a deal ,do a deal, or cut a deal, you complete an agreement or an arrangement with someone, especially in business.

example.ex: Japan will have to do a deal with America on rice imports...
example.tran: 日本将不得不与美国就大米的进口达成一笔交易。

example.ex: The two sides tried and failed to come to a deal...
example.tran: 双方都努力了，但还是没能达成协议。

entry.def: If a person, company, or shop deals in a particular type of goods, their business involves buying or selling those goods.

example.ex: ...the rights of our citizens to hold and to deal in foreign currency.
example.tran: 我们的公民持有和买卖外汇的权利

entry.def: If someone deals illegal drugs, they sell them.
If someone has had a bad deal, they have been unfortunate or have been treated unfairly.

example.ex: The people of Liverpool have had a bad deal for many, many years.
example.tran: 利物浦人多年来一直没有得到公正的待遇。

entry.def: If you deal playing cards, you give them out to the players in a game of cards.

example.ex: The croupier dealt each player a card, face down...
example.tran: 赌台管理员给每位玩家正面朝下发了一张牌。

example.ex: He once dealt cards in an illegal gambling joint.
example.tran: 他曾经在一个非法赌博点负责发牌。

entry.tran: 沉重打击;对…造成伤害（或损失）
entry.def: If an event deals a blow to something or someone, it causes them great difficulties or makes failure more likely.

example.ex: The summer drought has dealt a heavy blow to the government's economic record...
example.tran: 夏季的干旱已经对政府的经济业绩造成了沉重打击。

example.ex: The French were dealt another blow yesterday when Serge Viars withdrew from the squad.
example.tran: 昨天塞尔日·维亚尔退出该队令法国人又遭遇了一记重击。

means.word_mean: 1. a particular instance of buying or selling;

sentences.sentence: "it was a package deal"
"I had no further trade with him"
"he's a master of the business deal"

means.word_mean: 2. an agreement between parties (usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each;

sentences.sentence: "he made a bargain with the devil"
"he rose to prominence through a series of shady deals"

means.word_mean: 3. (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent;

sentences.sentence: "a batch of letters"
"a deal of trouble"
"a lot of money"
"he made a mint on the stock market"
"it must have cost plenty"

means.word_mean: 4. a plank of softwood (fir or pine board)
5. wood that is easy to saw (from conifers such as pine or fir)
6. the cards held in a card game by a given player at any given time;

sentences.sentence: "I didn't hold a good hand all evening"
"he kept trying to see my hand"

means.word_mean: 7. the type of treatment received (especially as the result of an agreement);

sentences.sentence: "he got a good deal on his car"

means.word_mean: 8. the act of distributing playing cards;

sentences.sentence: "the deal was passed around the table clockwise"

means.word_mean: 9. the act of apportioning or distributing something;

sentences.sentence: "the captain was entrusted with the deal of provisions"

means.word_mean: 1. deal with verbally or in some form of artistic expression;

sentences.sentence: "This book deals with incest"
"The course covered all of Western Civilization"
"The new book treats the history of China"

means.word_mean: 2. take action with respect to (someone or something);

sentences.sentence: "How are we going to deal with this problem?"
"The teacher knew how to deal with these lazy students"

means.word_mean: 3. take into consideration for exemplifying purposes;

sentences.sentence: "Take the case of China"
"Consider the following case"

means.word_mean: 4. come to terms or deal successfully with;

sentences.sentence: "We got by on just a gallon of gas"
"They made do on half a loaf of bread every day"

means.word_mean: 5. administer or bestow, as in small portions;

sentences.sentence: "administer critical remarks to everyone present"
"dole out some money"
"shell out pocket money for the children"
"deal a blow to someone"

means.word_mean: 6. do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood;

sentences.sentence: "She deals in gold"
"The brothers sell shoes"

means.word_mean: 7. be in charge of, act on, or dispose of;

sentences.sentence: "I can deal with this crew of workers"
"This blender can't handle nuts"
"She managed her parents' affairs after they got too old"

means.word_mean: 8. behave in a certain way towards others;

sentences.sentence: "He deals fairly with his employees"

means.word_mean: 9. distribute to the players in a game;

sentences.sentence: "Who's dealing?"

means.word_mean: 10. direct the course of; manage or control;

sentences.sentence: "You cannot conduct business like this"

means.word_mean: 11. give out as one's portion or share
12. give (a specific card) to a player;

sentences.sentence: "He dealt me the Queen of Spades"

means.word_mean: 13. sell;

sentences.sentence: "deal hashish"

means.word_mean: 1. made of fir or pine;

sentences.sentence: "a plain deal table"

list.explanation: (指某事物)不难，不重要，没问题，不麻烦

example.en: Don't worry. It's no big deal.
What she did is no biggie.

example.en: Getting a passport's no big deal.

Sentence.sentence: There is no question that the United States imports a great deal of energy and, in fact, relies on that steady flow to maintain its economy.
One of the challenges to build an interactive digital textbook from the ground up is that is takes a great deal of manpower.
That sounds like a bad deal for the power company, but it's not
By last year, Wall Street traders, bankers and those who deal in real estate generated 21% of the national income, double their share in the 1950s.
It does not deal with any aspect of city life in depth

My colleagues and I are studying something called augmented reality (a field of computer research dealing with the combination of real-world and virtual reality)," said Christopher Dede, professor in learning technologies at Harvard University, "Alien Contact," for example, is an exercise developed for middle-school students who use hand-held devices that can determine their location.

sentences.en: Who's going to deal out the money?

sentences.en: Deal four cards to each player.

sentences.en: He dealt her a blow on the side of her face.

jushi.english: The country threatened to deal elsewhere and pay cash on the barrel head, but it is not likely to move its opponent.
jushi.chinese: 这个国家扬言要到别处去买石油,但这种威胁不可能吓倒其对手。

jushi.english: He is dealt at that shop for 20 years.
jushi.chinese: 20年来，他常在那家商店买东西。
